intro: Siphotria, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a genus of flowering plants in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is characterized by its silver or grayish foliage, which is covered in fine, reflective hairs. The plants typically have small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. Siphotria species are native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. They are often found in rocky soils and can thrive in environments with limited water availability.
